caption: Honestly don't know what to say I when to this place on 01/28/2020 at 7 pm and it was close apparently permanently because it looked horrible the place , if you are close please at least have courtesy of letting people know in the wedsite or put an update on google because I drove 25 minutes to get there pay for parking just to realize
FANTASTIC! I definitely recommend to anyone who has a tongue for Asian cuisine!!

First off, when you get there, tell them "Rich & Steve sent us" and they'll get you a free drink ask for a "whatever". Second, great sushi and ramen(you can get extra ramen for 2 bucks but be ready for a ton of noodles). Third, the staff is awesome and almost entirely female. Fourth, it's a cool small spot that could use some help getting through this crazy time. Fifth, let them know what you think of their food, really, they're always open to input from customers. Love this place and will stop in every time I'm in the area.

Staff- friendly and efficient. Ramen- best I’ve ever had. Wings- Crisp light breading, sweet soy based sauce, and topped off with a sprinkling of sesame seeds...Perfection! Gyoza- How do you make gyoza magical?! I don’t know how they did it it they did.
They got really good food my first time there

Took my daughter for her 16th birthday and is not what we expected and definitely won’t go back. The only saving grace was the waitress who was very friendly but probably because we were the only ones there. The sushi and ramen were okay but way overpriced. We ordered three different ramen dishes but they all tasted the same. The menu online is not the current one they have at the restaurant which was highly disappointing. The men’s bathroom, according to my fiancé,  was the most disgusting public restroom he has ever seen. Don’t bother wasting your time or money.
Great place❤️😭

This is our first visit to BARkaya. It is located on Worthington Street between Main and Dwight Street. The area has been revamped and has a trendy look and much more lighting. The metered parking til 6pm then not necessary to feed meter on the street, but there is a parking lot that can be utilized for a small charge. The restaurant store front sets it apart from the other establishments as it catches your eye. It's a small trendy place, and has a bar area and table seating. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The ramen was good. I would like to see a spicy option in their selection. We ordered the pork ramen. The pork was very good! We also order 2 sushi rolls,  and found the to be very well made and of good quality!! I believe that BARkaya is a good fit for this area, and that more people will discover that as more people are drawn to the area with all the renovations being done in downtown Springfield!!!
Very good sushi and ramen soup
Sushi is great. Good location to eat dinner then go out after. Bartenders are friendly. Will continue going back.
Love Ti the waitress, she's great and so is the ramen!!! Were there every Monday!!

Was really excited to try this based off the reviews. Beef ramen was excellent, appetizer was great, but the sushi..... was on grocery store level at best. Way too much rice and not enough filling. My shrimp tempura roll wasnt even crispy, it was so mushy it was like it was refrigerated. Not sure if it was just an off day or just the chef.. but these rolls are VERY over priced for the quality I got, there are plenty of places around that are literally half the price and serve consistently great quality sushi.  And now on to the bathrooms, there was literally water leaking all over the floor from both restrooms into the restaurant , and  they were filthy. Someone was there I guess trying to fix them but didnt seem to have any success. I used the men's room and the toilet was cracked on the base and was leaking and the sink leaked everywhere as it drained.
The service was absolutely wonderful. The chef made great food, and the atmosphere is amazing! Perfect for after a long day at work.
Best ramen ever!!!!!

Went to grab a drink with my wife on a date. We love the ambiance of the restaurant and have gone back multiple times despite our orders always being somewhat wrong (wrong fish, wrong type of sushi etc).  Upon entering the restaurant tonight my wife and I stood in the entrance way for a solid 5 minutes during which time I made eye contact with every employee working - not even an acknowledgement of us standing there.  Since we were being ignored for so long we decided to leave. Out of curiosity I called from outside the door to see if they would ignore the phone. They picked up right away and  told me they didn't see us standing there. Come on the place isn't that big. Very rude workers will not be going back.
The food was good, pleasant atmosphere and nice setting. Only issue was the cost. I could get comparable food for half the price.
Very nice and clean
Great atmosphere the food is fantastic It's a little pricey for Springfield but worth it
I had a very good bowl of ramen. The pork belly was tasty and cooked to perfection. 👌
Really good food and atmosphere.

The interior design was very nice. It's got a sleek look to it with a bar that runs the majority of the restaurant, showcasing the sushi chef at the front and the head chef at the back. It is well lit but still dim enough to make for an intimate setting.  We arrived 5 minutes before opening but were still warmly greeted and seated by one of the servers. She had an excellent attitude and maintained a respectable level of professionalism while still having fun with us!  The food was incredible! We started off with some type of scallion stuffed beef skewers... yum! The sauce was fantastic. I wished it was a little thicker so it could stick to the beef like a glazee but it was still amazing.  Our main course consisted of the Hamachi Hama (specialty roll), the Dragon Kaya (signature roll), tuna roll, tuna nigiri and yellowtail nigiri.  I have to start off by saying, the quality of their fish was exceptional. My wife and I are huge sushi fans and this stuck out significantly to us. The rolls were beautifully designed but their aesthetics were second to their amazing flavor profiles! The one thing I was put off by is the amount of roe they used in preparation. I'm not a fan to begin with so I may be biased here but i also genuinely believe they used too much.  Overall, I would recommend Bar Kaya!

Looks like a trendy sushi spot. Stuff is overpriced, they try to present it nicely but it's fair quality. The drinks looked decent, again pricy. Not a great place to stop if you're hungry and want a decent portion / value. Also not great if you want a good deal on a drink. Looked clean, ingredients were fresh, which is better than a few other places. Wouldn't go again, it's nothing special. The volcano roll was mushy and $20. Their regular rolls were thickly rolled. Edamame was fresh.  All and all, wouldn't recommend to anyone and I expect the place to be out of business within 3 years.  Everyone had a smile. The staff seemed to be trying. Bar management was irresponsible, and new people seemed to be needing to figure it out on their own.  It was clean. They get the 2 star for being clean. Im not worried that I got poisoned, which is better than most sushi in the area.  I think y'all have room to improve. Good luck.
From the service to the freshest sushi , hands down the best in the area.
So yummy!! Was a nice change of pace for my husband and I, and will definitely be going back to try more!

The place was awesome, went on Thursday with a coworker.  The Ramen is one of the best I have had, delicious. We went on Friday again with a bigger crew from work, they all loved it. I had the soup and some rolls. Everything was delicious,  great flavors.  Support this local spot.
What a fantastic atmosphere... spectacular sushi and simply out of this world ramen... we will be back often

So so so good!!! I love Ramen and recently discovered this hidden gem with a buddy. Have been coming back ever since. The veggie broth for the ramen is really tasty! And beside the food, every employee is incredibly pleasant & helpful. Highly recommend!

the ramen dish here was subpar at best. I ordered the curry chicken ramen the chicken was almost burnt to a crisp. l asked for extra ingredients like an extra egg and extra cabbage I got neither. the egg is supposed to be marinated it was just a plain hard boiled egg yuk!!!!! a complete disgrace to Ajitsuke Tamago. I have to say that the noodles themselves were very good  but the rest of the dish was just lacking. I was very excited about this place being that Springfield doesn't have any ramen spots and I was hoping this would be my new home for ramen. nope
This place is delicious and interesting!
Sushi is amazing
I love there food and drinks but they should open on Sunday to
What a beautiful place and the service is second to none. Truly one of a kind!
Great food

Ok so i fully realize that Springfield may not be the spot you think of for sushi!! Trust me. I am world wide traveler!! One of the best spots for cutting edge stuff!! If sushi not your thing. Ramen selections amazing!!
Nice ambiance, service, and presentation. Sushi was good too. A chill place to have a drink in Springfield with style.

Delicious chef-crafted ramen and sushi. Sit at the bar and you can see them making the food! Wonderfully friendly staff. I really enjoyed the bbq eel nigiri that they sear to order. Will definitely be back for more!

Hidden gem! Trendy and modern sushi and ramen bar right in downtown Springfield.  Staff was friendly, served us a warm bowl of ramen before they were officially open one snowy day.  All ramens are vegetable broth base, but don’t let this deter you. I had a delicious and savory pork ramen that I’d certainly try again.  Didn’t get a chance to try the sushi but I’d love to.
Ordered from there for the first time. Atmosphere very nice, food was exceptional! Looking forward to going back there. This is what Downtown Springfield needs!
Ramen Monday is the best day of the week

This place is such a great hidden gem of Springfield. I’ve gone before, but they recently added a lot of new items to their menu which elevated it to another level. Their new sushi rolls are as unique as they are delicious and their cocktail menu has delicious drinks I’ve never heard of! The staff is super friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend anyone in the area give it a try- you will definitely not fine sushi or drinks like this anywhere else in the area.
Awesome sushi even better Ramen. Drinks are also pretty good.
Love the food, the staff and the owner.
This place was AWSOME!!! The service was fast and they were all super nice! I HIGHLY recommend coming here!!! 😄
Friendly and very attentive staff and the food was fantastic. Decided to go here on a whim and I'm very happy about it.

Came for lunch. The staff is extremely friendly and great to chat with. Quick service, and a really fun atmosphere. I can imagine it's even nicer at night for dinners. Great assortment of food, and everything was delicious. My new favorite sushi restaurant in the area.
Excellent food service and atmosphere

Just finished the best meal I feel I'll have this year. Spicy tuna roll was amazing and the beef and scallion ramen bowl closed out the night with a bang. What a beautiful place and a friendly inviting staff. Thank you for the phenomenal meal

Such a beautiful restaurant. We can’t wait to go back. We sat at the bar and watched the cutest man make sushi, he was so organized and efficient he made everything by himself. Truly was artistic to watch. Like I said great food, great service and perfect atmosphere for a date night or a night out with friends.
Excellent food, drinks and service. This has become my go to Friday night spot. Fantastic service from everyone and fantastic eats.
Sushi and ramen were on point, I was very satisfied with the quality. I'll be needing another trip back to try the pork ramen as I got the beef this time.
Awesome

Well, this is a difficult one to write- a mixed bag of a review I guess. First of all, the space is excellent, nice decor and a very comfortable space. 3 of us came to enjoy Sushi, and we did not take them up on the Omakase, preferring to order a la carte. They have a good selection of drinks, we were interested in beer and Saké. We had a local beer on draft which was great. The Saké only came in little cans, but was good.  We ordered Spicy Edamame, and the amount was pitifully small, and not at all spicy. We asked for a second order and were told they were out of Edamame- not sure how you can run out of Edamame on a Friday night. They offered fried Shishito Peppers as an alternate, which were good, but too large and slightly undercooked. We ordered a lot of different Sushi, Sashimi and rolls. Our server came back and told us that they were out of a couple of items, so we ordered some alternates. It took forever to get our food, and it came out in bits and spurts. And while we each ordered some of the same orders as each other, she only brought out one order for all of us. Also, even though the original menu we read online said the were 2 Nigiri per order, this is no longer the case- be aware that it is one piece of Nigiri/Sashimi per order- it gets very expensive quick!  We started realizing that many of the items were not showing up, and we were told they had run out of them, again, surprising on a Friday night. They even ran out of the Saké we were drinking. No Ikura, no Otoro or Chu Toro, Hokkigai, Tako, Amaebi...  Okay, so the Sushi itself was good, albeit expensive, the 3 of us paid $350.00 pretip for what we ate and drank. We figured 9 pieces of basic Nigiri Sushi cost $41.00 (see photo).  I am willing to give them a second chance, maybe I'll try the Omakase next time...
Very friendly service. The food was amazing. My wife and I enjoyed everything we ordered. I recommend trying the tempura soft crab
Really good Sushi and Ramen

Went for my birthday. They had run out of 3 of the menu items I wanted and we had to wait more than 30 minutes for the chef selection of sushi because the bar got too busy. The ramen didn't have as much flavor as one would hope. Really good drink selections however and the food was fresh.
Their ramen is excellent.

First time there and it wouldn't be my last, my GF had the tuna rolls, the tuna was so fresh and tasty I had the beef Ramen and it was great as well, the place is well kept and the staff is super friendly.
I was excited to finally have a sushi place downtown. Beautiful place, server was nice. But the portions were half of what they should be. I was very dissapointed. I would not return.
Food was good , overpriced for what it really is. Menu is limited. The bartender was sociable and my speciality drinks were excellent
The food was to die for, the drinks were great. The bartender and server was very nice. Great service and good food!
The best!
Ramen was delicious, service was fast (this was on a Wednesday evening and it was quiet), and everyone was very kind and helpful. Definitely going to be back.

I had the hot pepper appetizer, one of their special cocktails, tuna, salmon roe, spicy tuna, and unagi (eel) sushi.  Excellent, friendly service, delicious sushi.  Treat yourself to this new trendy restaurant on Worthington Street in downtown Springfield.
Food was delicious! The Beef Ramen was amazing!

A gem!! Some of the best maki rolls I have ever had...and that is saying something! Great atmosphere, engaged staff, and just wonderful food. Please find this place..you won’t regret it...and make sure to ask for  ‘T’ ...great bartender...good mixer and personality. Enjoy!
Great ramen! Great service! The watermelon vodka soda was delish!
Amazing food, great atmosphere, friendly staff.
Sushi is disgusting and INCREDIBLY over priced just another hole in the wall looking to make a quick dollar.
Amazing people, and the absolute best food always 🥰
Food was great and service was great. Everyone was friendly.
Excellent!!
Amazing Service and Really Amazing Food!
Called and ordered 2 Avocado rolls, a spicy tuna, and a eel avocado roll. $46. $9 per avocado roll. That's 1/4 cup is rice and two tablespoons worth of avocado. $9
Amazing ramen and shrimp tempura, sexy atmosphere and beautifully crafted cocktails. Will be back absolutely a must try.
Heck of a place. Great service. Amazing food. Nothing close in the area. Could not recommend more.
Their plum wine and special drink of the day was amazing!!! They also have Great Customer Service

Hands down, the best sushi and sashimi in Western MA.  Impeccable quality.  Masterful presentation.  Unmatched creativity.  Paired with an impressive selection of Japanese whiskey, and refreshing cocktails.  Well done. 5 star.
The sushi was disappointing and sad looking. The appetizer was so small and way over priced! While the place itself looks great i wasnt a fan of the food. And the drink was ok.
Fresh fish, good vibes
Food was amazing.  Highly recommend BARkaya!
We tried the sushi and the ramen. Having eaten sushi in Japan I can honestly say the nigiri is the best I have had in the states. I will be back.
Pork Ramen for sure! Friendly and attentive staff as well.

I had the pleasure of going to BARkaya on Saturday after booking a reservation for the Omakase Tasting Menu.  There are not enough adjectives to describe how incredible the experience was as a whole.  From the moment you walk through the door the entire staff makes you feel like family.  The attention they paid to you to ensure you had an amazing experience was equally matched by the flavors they presented.  The 13 course Omakase Experience was simply brilliant and each course was prepared so delicately in front of your eyes.  Everything was fresh and plated with such a thoughtfulness from pairings on each course to the vibrant colors on each plate.  This is one restaurant you will want to visit as soon as possible.  Make sure to make a reservation for the Omakase Tasting Menu.   The final course in the tasting is hands down the greatest single bite of food I have ever had.

This is our first visit to BARkaya. It is located on Worthington Street between Main and Dwight Street. The area has been revamped and has a trendy look and much more lighting. The metered parking til 6pm then not necessary to feed meter on the street, but there is a parking lot that can be utilized for a small charge. The restaurant store front sets it apart from the other establishments as it catches your eye. It's a small trendy place, and has a bar area and table seating. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The ramen was good. I would like to see a spicy option in their selection. We ordered the pork ramen. The pork was very good! We also order 2 sushi rolls,  and found the to be very well made and of good quality!! I believe that BARkaya is a good fit for this area, and that more people will discover that as more people are drawn to the area with all the renovations being done in downtown Springfield!!!

My wife and I went to BARkaya with high expectations, and we were not disappointed.  The restuarant itself is meticulously designed, modern elements that blend seamlessly with respect to the area's historic roots.  We did the 13 course Omakase which gave us a wide array of some of the best sushi and sashimi I've ever had in my life, prepared right in front of us by Chef Chow.  A few courses were non-traditional, but were fantastic non-the-less (standing out was the slightly seared waygu beef sashimi topped with shaved truffles).  Absolutely phenomenal food, hands down.  The service was fantastic as well, every need was met.  Our waitress was awesome and the front end manager, knowing I had a soft spot for Japanese whiskey, brought some samples for me to try.  Speaking of the drinks, they are out of this world.  Each cocktail has some form of Japanese flavors are incorporated and are as delicate and thought out as the food itself, used as an enhancement to the cuisine, rather than a stand alone.  That's not to say that you shouldn't go for just the drinks, because you definitely should.  Overall, our diner at BARkaya was one of the best dining experiences in the city, maybe the region.  We will be back for the normal diner service, and try to conjure a special occasion to try to 22 course Omakase next.  We're been excited and impressed with the renaissance of our city, and BARkaya is a terrific addition to it.
The place is beautiful, but the food is BLAND. Good customer service fast service, noodles WERE TOUGH . The meat was BLAND. The broth didnt have enough FLAVOR
Great authentic Japanese with good price!
I want this place to succeed because it's closer than my usual ramen spot. The sushi was very good however the ramen was alittle bland, but being brand new I will definetly be going back again.
It's like they waived a magic wand over the interior. Beautiful. While  not a sushi eater myself, my friends say this place to get it.
Rolls were mostly rice, snd roll was falling apart. Service was long for lunch.
Best sushi in Western Mass. Sophisticated decor and a passion for the food.
Super excited Springfields finest
Tasting menu. New local home spot. You must make this a try. Looks like Wednesday for full open. Make your RSVPs.
